dt: {bc}a procedure or process for attaining an object: such as
{bc}a systematic procedure, technique, or mode of inquiry employed by or proper to a particular discipline or art
{bc}a systematic plan followed in presenting material for instruction
{bc}a way, technique, or process of or for doing something

dt.t: in the art of the novel, heavily armed with {wi}method{/wi}

dt: {bc}a discipline that deals with the principles and techniques of scientific inquiry

dt.t: The book is completely lacking in {wi}method{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the habitual practice of orderliness and regularity

dt.t: time enough to do everything if only you used {wi}method{/wi}

dt: {bc}a dramatic technique by which an actor seeks to gain complete identification with the inner personality of the character being portrayed

pt: {sc}method{/sc} {sc}mode{/sc} {sc}manner{/sc} {sc}way{/sc} {sc}fashion{/sc} {sc}system{/sc} mean the means taken or procedure followed in achieving an end. {sc}method{/sc} implies an orderly logical arrangement usually in steps.
{sc}mode{/sc} implies an order or course followed by custom, tradition, or personal preference.
{sc}manner{/sc} is close to {sc}mode{/sc} but may imply a procedure or method that is individual or distinctive.
{sc}way{/sc} is very general and may be used for any of the preceding words.

pt.t: has her own {it}way{/it} of doing things

pt: {sc}fashion{/sc} may suggest a peculiar or characteristic way of doing something.
{sc}system{/sc} suggests a fully developed or carefully formulated method often emphasizing rational orderliness.

et: Middle English, prescribed treatment, from Latin {it}methodus{/it}, from Greek {it}methodos{/it}, from {it}meta-{/it} + {it}hodos{/it} way
shortdef: a procedure or process for attaining an object: such as
a systematic procedure, technique, or mode of inquiry employed by or proper to a particular discipline or art
a systematic plan followed in presenting material for instruction

dt: {bc}a method of birth control involving abstinence during the period in which ovulation is most likely to occur

shortdef: a method of birth control involving abstinence during the period in which ovulation is most likely to occur

dt: {bc}principles and procedures for the systematic pursuit of knowledge involving the recognition and formulation of a problem, the collection of data through observation and experiment, and the formulation and testing of hypotheses

shortdef: principles and procedures for the systematic pursuit of knowledge involving the recognition and formulation of a problem, the collection of data through observation and experiment, and the formulation and testing of hypotheses

dt: {bc}a technique in acting by which an actor strives to empathize with the character being portrayed so as to effect a realistic interpretation

shortdef: a technique in acting by which an actor strives to empathize with the character being portrayed so as to effect a realistic interpretation

dt: {bc}good reasons for one's actions even though they may seem foolish or strange

dt.t: Though his staff is often confused by the way he runs the office, I've found that there's {it}(a) method in/to his madness{/it}.

shortdef: good reasons for one's actions even though they may seem foolish or strange

dt: {bc}the process that is used by scientists for testing ideas and theories by using experiments and careful observation

shortdef: the process that is used by scientists for testing ideas and theories by using experiments and careful observation

dt: {bc}a system of teaching law in which instruction is chiefly on the basis of leading or selected cases as primary authorities instead of from textbooks

shortdef: a system of teaching law in which instruction is chiefly on the basis of leading or selected cases as primary authorities instead of from textbooks —called also case method

dt: {bc}a method for the differential staining of bacteria by treatment with a watery solution of iodine and the iodide of potassium after staining with a triphenylmethane dye (such as crystal violet)

shortdef: a method for the differential staining of bacteria by treatment with a watery solution of iodine and the iodide of potassium after staining with a triphenylmethane dye (such as crystal violet) —called also Gram's method
the chemicals used in Gram's stain
